title: I am going through a divorce and my wife's PDD is grossly misstated and falsified. Are there any actions that I could take
question: to force a corrected schedule of Assets and Debts and Income? I filed a Motion to Compel that was granted and they did not comply with an Order so I am now filing a Motion for Sanctions. I was going to send a Meet and Confer to opposing counsel requesting a revised and correct PDD, but they have not been cooperative. Are there any Motions I could file asking the Court to Order my soon to be ex to provide correct PDDs?
question_tags: Divorce,Dividing debts in a divorce,Divorce and bankruptcy,Bankruptcy,Debt,Bankruptcy and debt,Divorce and family,Admissible evidence in criminal cases,Family law
answers: I'm assuming you have admissible evidence that the PDD is grossly misstated. If so you can present that evidence at the hearing. Depending on the amount of time before the hearing you could also propound discovery asking for information and documentation.

What are you trying to accomplish, besides showing that your ex is a bad person? Do you have the CORRECT information regarding the financial issues? (If not, how do you know your ex is lying?) Do you have it in a form that is evidence admissible in court?

Assuming you can prove the facts as they truly are, then you should get on with getting the case done. You probably would be well served to at least consult with an experienced family law attorney so you can do so.
